CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 20, 1968, pg. 5, reads: "Together in Evangelism - 'Baptists Together in Evangelism' was the theme and the pattern of the recent Evangelism Workshop co-sponsored by the white and Negro Baptist Association in Pittsburgh. Keynoters and workshop leaders for the two day session were Dr. Kelly Miller Smith of Nashville, Tenn., and Dr. Clarence Crawford of Washington, fourth and fifth from left. Other key people in picture are, reading from left, Revs. E. B. Hicks, associate program director, American Baptist Home Mission Societies; B. S. Mason, director evangelism, Allegheny Union Baptist Association; J. Richard Hawley, evangelism director, Pittsburgh Baptists; Dr. Brannon J. Hopson, AUBA moderator and Rev. Carlton B. Goodwin, executive secretary, Pittsburgh Baptists. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of seven men posed in church, left to right: Rev. E. B. Hicks, Rev. B. S. Mason, Rev. J. Richard Hawley, Dr. Kelly Miller Smith, Dr. Clarence Crawford, Dr. Brannon J. Hopson, and Rev. Carlton B. Goodwin, gathered for "Baptists Together in Evangelism" workshop sponsored
